sentences.english: According to the story, Lao-tzu, the older of the two sages, thought very little of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 据说，两位圣人中那位年长的老于很瞧不起孔子。

sentences.english: Older women already predominate on organized sightseeing tours.
sentences.chinese: 年长的女性在各种观光旅游团中已占大多数。

sentences.english: And then my oldest brother said, 'Morgan, people eat this their whole lives.
sentences.chinese: 我最年长的哥哥说，“莫根，人们一辈子都在吃这个。

sentences.english: Individual history of hypersensitivity disease in infant asthma has more value than that in the older one.
sentences.chinese: 婴幼儿个人过敏性疾病史对诊断哮喘较年长儿有价值。

sentences.english: My brother is senior to me by two years.
" There are no "masters" in an STO network, but there are "elders".
sentences.chinese: 在STO网络中没有“大师”，但是有“年长者”。

sentences.english: The older man was buried with jade and amber collars and bracelets and pearl ornaments.
sentences.chinese: 年长的男子的殉葬品有玉器琥珀项圈手镯，珍珠饰品。

sentences.english: As I was finishing my meal, an older couple came in to dine.
sentences.chinese: 就在快吃完的时候，一对年长的夫妇走进来用餐。

sentences.english: The elder judge finally decided that either Sara or May would get the position.
sentences.chinese: 年长的评审官最后决定当选者要么是萨拉，要么是梅。

sentences.english: In older women though, going blonde may speed up the greying process.
sentences.chinese: 但年长的女性如果漂染金发可能会加速白发的生成。

sentences.english: Older participants favored the GPS-like stimulus-response method.
sentences.chinese: 年长的参与者更喜欢类似GPS的刺激反应方法。

sentences.english: but also older people, probably right up to pensioners, and yeah.
sentences.chinese: 但是也有年长的人，可能老到领养老金的人。

sentences.english: I would not call thee fool, old man.
sentences.chinese: 我不会唤汝愚人，年长知者。

sentences.english: The old matriarchs make decisions on a daily basis as to where the herd will forage or move.
sentences.chinese: 年长的首领每天决定象群觅食或移动的地点。

sentences.english: The elder welder seldom yields his field.
sentences.chinese: 年长的焊接工很少放弃他的场地。

sentences.english: Seniors use the health care system more than anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 而年长者比其他人都要更多的使用医保系统。

definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)
of the same generation/person of the same generation/peer
lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people
to be in the prime of life
lit. robust years/prime of life/summer/able-bodied (fit for military service)/mature (talent, garden etc)
to not be wiser despite being older/to be older than (you) by (humble)
